CaseDesc: On April 26, 1993, at approximately 1:30am, Rafat Abugazia was last seen by his roommate in Toronto, Ontario.
Name: ABUGAZIA, Rafat Mahmoud

CaseDesc: On August 26, 2015 Lester Sampson was reported missing from Glen Vowell First Nation Village in B.C. This community is located on the west side of the Skeena River between Hazelton and Kispiox. Mr. Sampson’s brother last saw him at his residence in Glen Vowell on August 25, 2015.
Name: SAMPSON, Lester Charles

CaseDesc: On August 3rd, 1986, RCMP received a report of a missing person. The manager of Sickle Lake Lodge called advising Mr. Hrynick went missing in the early morning hours. Mr. Hrynick was with friends during the evening before and into the early morning. According to them, Mr. Hrynick had been very quiet over the couple days leading up to his disappearance. The evening of his disappearance, Mr. Hrynick was described as intoxicated. At one point, witnesses observed him stumbling on his way out the door of the cabin. The other men went out to search for Mr. Hrynick about 15 minutes later. They could hear a boat but could not see Mr. Hrynick. The empty boat was located the following day. An extensive land and water search failed to locate Mr. Hrynick. There was no indication that Mr. Hrynick found his way to the shore and he has not been seen since.
Name: HRYNICK, Terry Mitchel

Tattoo: Left Forearm, lady on a mushroom
CaseDesc: Steven WOYTOWICH is believed to be homeless and was last seen in the Beverly area of Edmonton, Alberta, in early March of 2020.
Name: WOYTOWICH, Steven Greg

CaseDesc: On March 26, 2006, Tommy Clément-Pépin was seen for the last time at approximately 11:00 a.m., in a hotel in Rouyn-Noranda, Quebec. His vehicle was located in a parking lot in Rouyn-Noranda, Quebec.
Name: CLEMENT, Tommy

Teeth: Visible Missing, Some missing teeth with some decay; he has cracked lower left teeth
Boots: Black, Motorcycle boots with a buckle on each boot
Tattoo: Torso (Back), small ladybug between shoulder blades
CaseDesc: Dave MacDermott was last seen on or about Saturday November 9, 2002 in Kitchener, Ontario. He had been out celebrating a friend’s birthday. It was initially reported that Dave left town with his dog and his 1990 Ford Mustang. However, his vehicle was located parked in a parking lot near his residence and his dog was found wandering the neighbourhood.
Name: MACDERMOTT, David Michael

CaseDesc: During the early morning hours of Friday, October 1st, 2010, Janice Cher Desjarlais and her boyfriend crawled into a dumpster located behind The Center of Hope on Franklin Avenue in Fort McMurray. Janice's boyfriend advised that he left at approximately 7:30 a.m. to go to McDonald’s restaurant. When he returned at around 8:30 a.m., Janice was gone. When he was unable to find her, he suspected that the dumpster may have been emptied during his absence. On October 3rd, video surveillance of the area confirmed that the dumpster had been picked up at 8:22 a.m. on October 1st. It also showed the departure of Janice's boyfriend, but no one else entering or leaving the dumpster. On October 5th, a major excavation of the landfill was started, but by the time the search was completed on October 14th, Janice had not been located.
Name: DESJARLAIS, Janice Cher

CaseDesc: In March of 1975, “Rocky” FIDDLER, 14 years old, was reported missing by his family when he failed to return home.  It was learned, as a result of the investigation, that he was last seen in July of 1975 at a Powwow at Thunderchild First Nation, Saskatchewan, which is approximately 1.5 hours from Meadow Lake, Saskatchewan.  Investigation and searches have failed to locate him.
Name: FIDDLER, Barry Rocky

CaseDesc: Bonnie Joan Thomas (née Cooper) of Rollingdam, just outside of St. Stephen, NB, met with some friends and went across the U.S. border to the Legion in Calais, Maine.  They went to a St. Patrick's Day dance. After the evening's celebrations, Bonnie left the Legion alone in her red 1973 Volvo station wagon. She drove back through the Calais/St. Stephen border crossing into Canada. At the Canadian entry point Bonnie hit the customs booth causing minor damage to her car. She was last seen talking to the Customs Officer. The next morning her husband realized she was missing, and called the police. Bonnie's car was found abandoned on March 18, 1978, near St. Stephen on a logging road near the St Croix River.
Name: THOMAS, Bonnie Joan

Jacket: Nylon, Blue, White, Has 3 vertical stripes
CaseDesc: On July 17, 1992, Marshall Holmes wandered into the bush near Vassar, Manitoba and has not been seen since. Mr. Holmes was 73 years old at the time and was described as a recluse and a hermit. Mr. Holmes had gone missing in the past and had returned on his own accord. He enjoyed being in the bush and liked to sleep in the long grass. The last time he went missing he was gone for 3 days and came out of the bush when he became hungry. Extensive searches were done by land, air and with the assistance of a police dog. Marshall Holmes has never been located.
Name: HOLMES, Marshall Wheeler

Sweater: Wool, Dark Blue, Red collar turtle neck
Scar: Left Side Of Head, 10 inch scar from temple to under the chin
CaseDesc: On January 2, 1993, at approximately 12:00pm, Mario Lencina was last seen in Toronto, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, Mario was on his way to Spain and his belongings were located at the airport, but he did not board the plane.
Name: LENCINA, Mario

Mark: Cheek, Mole on the right cheek
CaseDesc: On May 11, 2001, at approximately 8:00 p.m., Younes Taleb was seen for the last time at his mother’s business in Toronto, Ontario.
Name: TALEB, Younes

Scar: Nose, One inch long, left side
CaseDesc: On July 10th, 1998, Ronald Oxley was last seen leaving his residence in Thompson Manitoba. He told friends he was going to the bank and then to the grocery store. Mr. Oxley has not been seen or heard from since.
Name: OXLEY, Ronald Williamson

Tattoo: Left Forearm, Knife with snake, flower
CaseDesc: On the morning of the 6th of August 1979, Timothy Papik and his daughter Diane left Rankin Inlet, NU. heading towards Whale Cove, NU. in a canoe. They never reached their destination and they have not been seen since.
Name: PAPIK, Timothy

CaseDesc: On the morning of the 6th of August 1979, Timothy Papik and his daughter Diane left Rankin Inlet, NU. heading towards Whale Cove, NU. in a canoe. They never reached their destination and they have not been seen since.
Name: PAPIK, Diane

CaseDesc: Kristofer Couture drove his vehicle from Alberta to the lower mainland in British Columbia to find work and had cut off ties from his family. Kristofer worked construction for a short period of time while living in his vehicle near Maple Ridge, British Columbia. Kristofer also frequented a gym in Burnaby, British Columbia. Kristofer was last seen leaving the Royal Columbian Hospital in New Westminster, British Columbia on January 26, 2019. His unoccupied vehicle was seen the following day parked at the Elk Mountain Trail in Chilliwack, British Columbia. Kristofer was reported missing on May 17, 2019 and his vehicle was found parked at the same location.
Name: COUTURE, Kristofer Shawn

CaseDesc: Mr. Beauchamps was last seen on April 18, 1977 in Montreal. Mr.Beauchamps went to his sister's house after an argument with his boyfriend. He stayed there for a few days, and then left without giving any more news.
Name: BEAUCHAMPS, Denis

CaseDesc: Janet Derbyshire was last seen on December 4, 1976, in St. Joseph Island near Sault Ste. Marie, ON.  She was  seen jumping off the St. Joseph's Island Bridge into the  water. She was seen floating downstream for approximately .25 miles before she submerged under water. Janet Derbyshire is presumed drowned but her body has never been recovered.
Name: DERBYSHIRE, Janet

Mark: Left Forearm, Burn on the lower part
Right Forearm, Burn on the lower part
CaseDesc: On October 2, 2016, Gaétan Roy was seen for the last time at his residence in Quebec City, Quebec. He left with a considerable amount of his personal effects and without saying where he was going. His credit cards were last used on October 6, 2016, in the Calgary, Alberta area. Gaétan is known to be despondent and he is familiar with western Canada and National Parks.
Name: ROY, Gaetan

CaseDesc: On September 4, 1986, Rozebeh Kiani was seen for the last time in the Shaughnessy Village district of Montreal, Quebec. Rozebeh left all his personal belongings behind in his apartment and it is possible he may have travelled to Vancouver, British Columbia. Mr. Kiani speaks very little French or English.
Name: KIANI, Rozebeh

CaseDesc: In the early morning hours of March 8, 1985, an unidentified male was seen walking on the Miles Hart Bridge. Ten minutes later, one witness returned only to discover a pile of clothing. The clothing was later identified as belonging to Mr. Beardy. It is assumed Mr. Beardy took his own life, however his remains have never been recovered. No foul play is suspected in this matter.
Name: BEARDY, Johnson William

Jewelry: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Necklace with a silver ring on it

CaseDesc: On September 17, 1995, Bradley Wiesner was on an island in Manitou Lake, Saskatchewan, in the company of other individuals. He was seen for the last time at approximately 8:00 pm when he was swimming towards the boat they were using as it had started to float away from shore.
Name: WIESNER, Bradley James

CaseDesc: On July 7, 2010, Roosdianajati and Didik Harijanto were seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Roosdianajati and Didik were scheduled to work, but did not show up for their shifts.
Name: HARIJANTO, Didik

CaseDesc: On July 7, 2010, Roosdianajati and Didik Harijanto were seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Roosdianajati and Didik were scheduled to work, but did not show up for their shifts.

CaseDesc: Harris Hill was last seen on November 10, 2010. He was going into the woods on Westbay Road near Parrsboro, N.S. to drop off apples at his deer stand. Mr. Hill failed to return home.
Name: HILL, Harris Clinton

Mr. Sandhu left his home located in the North West area of Toronto in February of 2004 and never returned.  His family is desperately seeking answers.  Please contact the Toronto Police Service with any information that may assist in locating Mr. Sandhu.
Name: SANDHU, Jatinderpal Singh

CaseDesc: Sylvia Ann Guiboche was last seen around mid June 2003.  Sylvia is known to frequent the Sargent Avenue/Ellice Avenue area of Winnipeg, Manitoba.  Sylvia is at high risk of being exploited.
Name: GUIBOCHE, Sylvia Ann

Deformity: Right Leg, Crooked, walks with a limp
CaseDesc: On June 3, 2003, at approximately 9:00 a.m. a fisherman and his helper, Phillip McKay, left Berens River Manitoba to retrieve their commercial fishing nets from Sandy Bar Bay. Upon arrival, one of the nets got caught in the propeller of the boat motor, pulling the boat down. Shortly thereafter, 2 large waves capsized the boat and both men were thrown into the water. Both men were wearing oilers, making it difficult to swim. The fisherman survived and was treated for shock and hypothermia. The body of his helper, Phillip McKay was never located.  Phillip McKay is presumed dead due to drowning.
Name: MCKAY, Phillip

CaseDesc: On March 1, 2015, at approximately 10:30 a.m., Karrie-Ann Henry was seen for the last time leaving her home with some of her belongings.
Name: HENRY, Karrie-Ann

CaseDesc: On April 22nd, 2014 Andrew George Nicoll was reported missing from his home near Breton, Alberta. He was last seen on April 20, 2014. Extensive searches of his property and the surrounding county were conducted by ground and air. Mr. Nicoll has not been located.
Name: NICOLL, Andrew George

Hair: Brown, Wavy, Thick brown beard, moustache
Scar: Left Forearm, From wrist to elbow
CaseDesc: Eric Ram was last seen at 9:00 a.m., on October 5, 1991.  He left his residence to go to the local store to buy milk and a paper and never returned.
Name: RAM, Eric Stanley

CaseDesc: On November 11, 1970, at approximately 4:00 p.m., Edward Bucharest and his son, Barry Bucharest, were last seen by their family members in Kenora, Ontario. The pair had left from their cottage located on Kimberly Road, north shore of the Big Stone Bay in the municipality of Lake of the Woods, in a 14-foot fiberglass boat. The capsized boat, two life jackets, and other belongings were subsequently located.
Name: BUCHAREST, Barry Kevin

CaseDesc: On November 11, 1970, at approximately 4:00 p.m., Edward Bucharest and his son, Barry Bucharest, were last seen by their family members in Kenora, Ontario. The pair had left from their cottage located on Kimberly Road, north shore of the Big Stone Bay in the municipality of Lake of the Woods, in a 14-foot fiberglass boat. The capsized boat, two life jackets, and other belongings were subsequently located.
Name: BUCHAREST, Edward Vincent

CaseDesc: On November 3, 2018, Aaron Normandeau was seen for the last time by a friend on the Ottawa River in an aluminum boat. The boat capsized and Aaron went under the water and did not resurface.
Name: NORMANDEAU, Aaron

CaseDesc: David Goetz and Lucas Zenger were last seen on August 23, 1992, in the Owen Sound area. They went for a canoe ride.  They travelled down the shoreline along Kepple Township, towards Big Bay. The canoe was located approximately 1.5 miles off Cape Commodore.
Name: GOETZ, David Andrew

CaseDesc: David Goetz and Lucas Zenger were last seen on August 23, 1992, in the Owen Sound area. They went for a canoe ride.  They travelled down the shoreline along Kepple Township, towards Big Bay. The canoe was located approximately 1.5 miles off Cape Commodore.

CaseDesc: On October 26, 2019, Maysa Nouasri was last seen with her father, Larbi Nouasri, in the borough of Saint-Léonard in Montreal, Quebec. It is believed that the two have travelled to Algeria, without Maysa’s mother’s consent.
Name: NOUASRI, Maysa

CaseDesc: On January 3, 2022, at approximately 2:00 a.m., Karl Neff was seen for the last time leaving his residence in Port Colborne, Ontario. Karl has ties to the St. Catharines area in Ontario.
Name: NEFF, Karl

CaseDesc: Carol Shelleau was last seen on July 29 1988, by her children, as she was leaving her home in Sault Ste Marie, Ontario. Carol got on the back of her estranged husband's motorcycle and has not been seen since. Her estranged husband was found deceased in Vancouver in September 1988. The motorcycle involved was located in Sault Ste. Marie. Foul play is suspected.
Name: SHELLEAU, Carol Jean

CaseDesc: Immaculate Basil was last seen June 14, 2013 on a road in a remote area north of Fort St James, BC.
Name: BASIL, Immaculate Mary

CaseDesc: In 1999, Fathiya Mohamed was seen for the last time. Fathiya and her family had emigrated from Somalia to England and to different parts of Canada.
Name: MOHAMED, Fathiya

CaseDesc: On August 3, 1968, at approximately 4:30 p.m., Robert James Brown was last seen walking  from the Nazarene Camp to his home in the Village of Wilfred, Ontario. The Nazarene Camp was a Christian camp near Pefferlaw, where Robert's mother worked as a volunteer.  He never arrived home and was reported missing to the Georgina Township Police Service. There were reports that a person matching Robert's description was seen in the vicinity of Georgina Beach around the time that Robert was last seen. Numerous land and water searches failed to locate Robert.
Name: BROWN, Robert James

CaseDesc: On May 29, 1998, Marcus Schmidseder walked away from his family’s home in Mississauga. Marcus’s intended destination is unknown; there was a possible sighting of him in Massey, Ontario on June 9, 1998. He may have been attempting to make his way to the western provinces.
Name: SCHMIDSEDER, Marcus John
